pullRequest.body:
We define the q-expansion of a modular form (either as a power series or as a `FormalMultlinearSeries`), show it has radius of convergence at least 1, and show that it converges to the original form on the open unit ball.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [750e68c2b8](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20720/commits/750e68c2b89db60a37eb0451acced35e6819d2e0)

Import changes exceeding 2%

| %      | File |
| -      | -    |
| +25.92% | `Mathlib.Analysis.Complex.UpperHalfPlane.Exp` |

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Analysis.Complex.UpperHalfPlane.Exp | 1690 | 2128 | +438 (+25.92%) |
| Mathlib.NumberTheory.ModularForms.QExpansion | 2158 | 2172 | +14 (+0.65%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.NumberTheory.ModularForms.LevelOne` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.ModularForms.QExpansion`|14|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.Complex.UpperHalfPlane.Exp` `Mathlib.Analysis.SpecialFunctions.Trigonometric.Cotangent`|438|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ UpperHalfPlane.abs_qParam_lt_one`
`+ hasFPowerSeries_cuspFunction`
`+ hasSum_qExpansion`
`+ hasSum_qExpansion_of_abs_lt`
`+ qExpansion`
`+ qExpansionFormalMultilinearSeries`
`+ qExpansionFormalMultilinearSeries_apply_norm`
`+ qExpansionFormalMultilinearSeries_radius`
`+ qExpansion_coeff`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

> should this be called something like `qExpansionFormalMultilinearSeries`?
> 
> edit: woohps, that got sent too quickly! let me put it in the correct place.

The right answer is that this construct shouldn't be needed at all; rather, someone should add lemmas to `PowerSeries` replicating  the 1-dimensional case of `FormalMultilinearSeries`, in a way that avoids having to mention stuff like `mkPiAlgebraFin` explicitly. But I'm too lazy to write the considerable volumes of boilerplate code this would involve.

There's now a red "import increase" warning tag, as a consequence of moving the lemmas about `abs ð•¢` to `UpperHalfPlane.Exp`. However, that file previously only contained 1 lemma, and is only imported by `SpecialFunctions.Trigonometric.Cot`, which in turn isn't (yet) imported by anything at all. So I think this import increase is not troublesome for mathlib's import hierarchy.

> > should this be called something like `qExpansionFormalMultilinearSeries`?
> > edit: woohps, that got sent too quickly! let me put it in the correct place.
> 
> The right answer is that this construct shouldn't be needed at all; rather, someone should add lemmas to `PowerSeries` replicating the 1-dimensional case of `FormalMultilinearSeries`, in a way that avoids having to mention stuff like `mkPiAlgebraFin` explicitly. But I'm too lazy to write the considerable volumes of boilerplate code this would involve.

Fair enough, should we leave a TODO on the file so that when this gets done we can update it here?

> In this way qExpansion is only a function, right? Sooner or later we want it a bundled hom with more stucture: is this a lot of work or can be done here (for example that preverses 0 should be easy)?

This doesn't work with the current setup: we are defining it for any type satisfying the `ModularFormClass` typeclass, which needn't be a vector space, group, etc (e.g. if in future someone defines a type for "_normalised newforms_ of some level and weight", then that would satisfy `ModularFormClass`). Certainly the space of *all* mod forms of some level + weight has a vector-space structure and we could look at bundling q-expansions a linear map etc, but that would have to be a separate declaration.

> > In this way qExpansion is only a function, right? Sooner or later we want it a bundled hom with more stucture: is this a lot of work or can be done here (for example that preverses 0 should be easy)?
> 
> This doesn't work with the current setup: we are defining it for any type satisfying the `ModularFormClass` typeclass, which needn't be a vector space, group, etc (e.g. if in future someone defines a type for "_normalised newforms_ of some level and weight", then that would satisfy `ModularFormClass`). Certainly the space of _all_ mod forms of some level + weight has a vector-space structure and we could look at bundling q-expansions a linear map etc, but that would have to be a separate declaration.

Hmm, OK, I see. We will need to pay attention to not duplicate everything, since I think it would be nice to have a bundled hom in the case of the full space of modular forms. Do you think that this general version will be used, in contrast to, say, apply the bundled `qexpansion` map to the newform (say) viewed as a "normal" modular form?
I mean, do you expect to have sensible examples of `ModularFormClass` without a coercion to the full space of modular forms?

> I mean, do you expect to have sensible examples of `ModularFormClass` without a coercion to the full space of modular forms?

No, I don't think so; I guess `ModularFormClass` is precisely there to axiomatise "things which have a coercion to a space of modular forms". So there would be no loss in generality in only defining it for `ModularForm` rather than `ModularFormClass`, but there might be a loss of convenience (one more coercion to keep track of).

Multiple coercion vs multiple functions is a problem we'll have to think about, anyway this is the function, so let's merge it, thanks!

bors merge
Thanks Chris and Riccardo for the reviews!

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12794602629/job/35670094270)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12794602629/job/35670094607)

I guess for consistency we should have this. Other than that it LGTM! 

maintainer delegate (Edit: it seems I can't do this, so someone else will need to)

In this way `qExpansion` is only a function, right? Sooner or later we want it a bundled hom with more stucture: is this a lot of work or can be done here (for example that preverses `0` should be easy)?

should this be called something like `qExpansionFormalMultilinearSeries`? 

edit: whoops, that got sent too quickly! let me put it in the correct place.

I guess for consistency we should have this. Other than that it LGTM! 

maintainer delegate (Edit: it seems I can't do this, so someone else will need to)

In this way `qExpansion` is only a function, right? Sooner or later we want it a bundled hom with more stucture: is this a lot of work or can be done here (for example that preverses `0` should be easy)?

```suggestion
    â€–qExpansionFormalMultilinearSeries n f mâ€– = â€–(qExpansion n f).coeff â„‚ mâ€– := by
  rw [qExpansionFormalMultilinearSeries,
```

```suggestion
  simpa [qExpansionFormalMultilinearSeries] using hasSum_qExpansion_of_abs_lt n f hy
```
This should probably go where `UpperHalfPlane.abs_exp_two_pi_I_lt_one` is in ...`UpperHalfPlane/Exp`? its more general than that result, so can probably replace it or shorted the proof of it.

```suggestion
lemma qExpansionFormalMultilinearSeries_radius [NeZero n] [ModularFormClass F Î“(n) k] :
```

```suggestion
lemma qExpansionFormalMultilinearSeries_apply_norm (m : â„•) :
```

```suggestion
/-- The `q`-expansion of a level `n` modular form, bundled as a `FormalMultilinearSeries`. 
TODO: Maybe get rid of this and instead define a general API for converting `PowerSeries` to
`FormalMultlinearSeries`. -/
def qExpansionFormalMultilinearSeries : FormalMultilinearSeries â„‚ â„‚ â„‚ :=
  fun m â†¦ (qExpansion n f).coeff â„‚ m â€¢ ContinuousMultilinearMap.mkPiAlgebraFin â„‚ m _
```
Can you add this to "main definitions" in the doc at the beginning of the file? Thanks!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(ModularForms/QExpansion): define q-expansions
